sentences.en: Children are sensitive to disapproval and adjust their behaviour accordingly.
sentences.cn: 孩子们对批评十分敏感,并会相应地调整自己的行为.

sentences.en: Excessive conformity is usually caused by fear of disapproval.
sentences.cn: 过于墨守成规通常都是由于担心得不到认可。
他唠唠叨叨地表示反对.

sentences.en: He flies in the face of public disapproval.
His action had been greeted with almost universal disapproval.
sentences.cn: 他的行动遭到了几乎一致的反对。

sentences.en: Persistent disapproval or criticism can be highly demoralizing.
sentences.cn: 一再的否定和批评可能会对信心造成严重打击。

sentences.en: She curled up her lips with disapproval.
sentences.cn: 她不以为然地翘起了嘴唇.

sentences.en: She underlined her disapproval of the proceedings by walking out.
sentences.cn: 她退席以表示不赞成这些做法.

sentences.en: Sumner would greet us with frowns and grimaces, doing his best to express wordless disapproval.
sentences.cn: 萨姆纳会冲我们皱眉，做苦脸，竭力表示他无言的反对。

sentences.en: The teacher made an outward show of disapproval.
sentences.cn: 老师表面上表示不同意.

words.tran_cn: 不以为然地；非难地；不赞成地
作出一种声响以表不满

trans.tran_en: an attitude that shows you think that someone or their behaviour, ideas etc are bad or not suitable
